article.title: The Microtext Reading Room: Part II
article.author: Fair, J.
article.text: Part I dealt with the selection of a microtext manager and with procedural consideration in the acquisition process. Part II continues the discussion about acquisitions, including considerations of format, variation, and reliability of publisher-supplied project information. The Library's search for an adequate system of bibliographic control is examined. Cataloging methods, classification schemes, and hardcopy guides and indexes are discussed as components of bibliographic control.
